title: U.S. aluminum prices hit record highs amid tariffs, low supply
summary: U.S. aluminum prices have surged 40% since tariffs were raised to 50% in June, with prices climbing above $5,200 per metric ton. The Midwest aluminum premium hit a record high of 96 cents per pound ($2,116 per ton) as tight global supplies and low U.S. inventories exacerbate the impact of tariffs on industries including automotive, aerospace, packaging, and construction.

title: Aluminum Hits 3-year High
summary: Aluminum increased to $2,999 per metric ton, reaching its highest level since April 2022. Over the past four weeks, aluminum gained 3.64%, and over the last 12 months, it increased 18.54%.

title: SHFE aluminium night session breaks through 25,000
summary: LME aluminum closed at $3,191 per tonne, up 1.33%, with prices reaching a high of $3,200 per tonne during the session. The market continues to experience tightness driven by supply constraints in China and Europe, though demand suppression is intensifying as the Chinese New Year approaches.

title: NALCO Shares Skyrocket to Record High as Aluminum Prices Breach $3,000 Mark
summary: National Aluminum Company Ltd. (NALCO) shares surged 6% as global aluminum prices crossed $3,000 per tonne for the first time in over three years. Supply constraints in China and Europe, coupled with strong demand from construction and renewables sectors, are driving the rally.

title: Aluminum Price Spikes: Supply Concerns Drive Rally
summary: London Metal Exchange aluminum futures reached $3,008 per tonne, marking the first breach above $3,000 since mid-2022. The rally is driven by supply concerns and market constraints.

title: SMM January 13 News: Aluminum Ingot and Billet Warehouse Outflows Increase
summary: According to SMM statistics, outflows from warehouses of aluminum ingots reached 149,000 mt last week, an increase compared to prior periods. This indicates rising demand or movement in aluminum inventories. The update highlights shifts in aluminum ingot and billet stocks as of January 13.

title: Aluminum Inventory Update: Social Stocks Decline While Billet Stocks Rise
summary: SMM reports changes in aluminum inventories as of January 13, with social stocks declining and billet stocks rising. This follows a decline in alumina raw material prices, leading to expected month-on-month decreases in total aluminum costs for January. The update reflects ongoing dynamics in aluminum supply and production costs.

title: Aluminum Sector 2026: Strategic Plays in a Supply-Constrained World
summary: Alcoa is advancing green aluminum production through innovations like ELYSIS™ and ASTRAEA™, which eliminate direct greenhouse gas emissions by using inert anodes instead of carbon ones. The company secured a 10-year renewable energy deal with NYPA and invested $60M in smelter modernization to reduce emissions. These circular economy initiatives position Alcoa to meet rising demand for low-carbon aluminum amid decarbonization priorities.

title: Hydro joins Alumobility to accelerate aluminium adoption in the automotive industry
summary: Hydro has joined Alumobility to promote aluminum in automotive applications, leveraging its low-carbon production and advanced materials for lighter, more energy-efficient vehicles. The collaboration focuses on knowledge sharing, innovation in lightweight architectures, and sustainability goals for OEMs. Hydro's expertise spans the aluminum value chain, including extrusions, components, and recycling, to drive circular solutions.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever debut carbon-free aluminium aerosol packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever launched carbon-free aluminum aerosol cans using the ELYSIS process, which replaces carbon emissions in smelting with oxygen to eliminate direct GHG emissions. This innovation combines higher recycled content and low-carbon primary aluminum for sustainable packaging in personal and home care sectors. The partnership demonstrates material-level advancements for decarbonization ahead of COP30.

title: January US ferrous scrap seen $20-30/gt up as mills raise early 2026 offers
summary: January US ferrous scrap prices are expected to rise by $20-30/gt as mills increase early 2026 offers. Northeast busheling scrap could settle near $370-390/gt, up $30/gt, while shredded grades are also projected higher. This reflects ongoing market adjustments into the new year.

title: North EU HRC futures firming on CME
summary: CME north EU hot-rolled coil (HRC) futures prices increased, with second-quarter strips trading at €676/t and further appetite noted. March material traded at €663-665/t, driven by supply constraints and firmer sentiment in the EU steel market. Strength may also stem from rallies in Chinese coking coal futures.

title: Steel Prices in the Second Week of January 2026
summary: Global iron and steel markets showed relative price stability during the second week of January 2026. Price movements were limited amid ongoing market conditions. This indicates a steady trend without significant fluctuations.

title: Taiwan's CSC announces new steel prices for Jan and Q1 2026
summary: Taiwan's CSC has announced price increases for January and Q1 2026. Monthly contracts for hot-rolled coils, cold-rolled coils, and hot-rolled plates will rise by NT$300/ton. Quarterly prices remain mostly flat, with minor adjustments.

title: The TEX Report - January 13, 2026
summary: The daily report covers steel market updates, including stainless steel scrap import volumes and LME prices for Ni, Co, and Mo as of early January 2026. It notes prices rose 13-14% from the prior month in some segments. This provides insights into raw material trends affecting steel production.

title: Cleveland-Cliffs Steelton plant to officially close early 2026
summary: Cleveland-Cliffs announced the permanent closure of its Steelton plant, following months after the company idled the facility with 500 layoffs. The closure decision was driven by weak demand and insufficient pricing for products produced at the facility.

title: AISI: US' raw steel production in week ending Jan 3 rises w-o-w, y-o-y
summary: U.S. raw steel production for the week ending January 3, 2026 reached 1.704 million net tons with a capability utilization rate of 74.4 percent. This represents a 1.4% increase compared to the previous year.

title: Metal Market Update: Steel & Aluminum Prices Heading Into 2026
summary: Steel prices are expected to increase heading into Q1 2026, driven by mill maintenance downtime, the Nippon/US Steel situation, and coating extras. Lead times are stretching as inventories are refilled, with price increases anticipated to take effect in mid to late January.

title: Domestic Iron and Steel Industry Urges Congress to Maintain Buy America in Upcoming Transportation Bill
summary: The domestic iron and steel industry is advocating for Congress to maintain Buy America provisions in the upcoming transportation bill.

title: Green Steel Market 2026-2035: Driving Sustainability in the Steel Industry
summary: The Green Steel Market is gaining momentum as a key enabler of decarbonization in heavy industries, driven by hydrogen-based steelmaking and electric arc furnaces powered by renewables. Governments' net-zero targets, corporate demands for low-carbon materials, and declining green hydrogen costs are fueling growth despite high initial investments. Continuous innovations in electrolysis and energy storage are expected to make green steel economically viable and mainstream.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturing is advancing with green innovations like lower-carbon electric arc mini-mills that recycle scrap, reducing reliance on coal and cutting emissions by 37% per ton since 1990. Startups such as Hertha Metals and Electra are pioneering coal-free processes using renewable energy, offering energy efficiency and cost advantages over traditional methods. These developments signal potential full decarbonization amid rising investor activity.

title: Copper surges past $13,000/t as bull run gains pace
summary: The three-month copper price closed at $13,230/t, up 3.04% on the day and 5.8% since January 2. The rally is supported by financial investors seeking safe-haven assets amid geopolitical uncertainty, with expectations of a 650,000–850,000t copper concentrate supply shortfall in 2026.

title: Comex Copper Settles 2.21% Higher at $5.9850
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for January delivery gained 12.95 cents per pound to $5.9850, marking the largest one-day gain since January 5, 2026. This represents the second-highest close in history and is up 6.31% month-to-date.

title: Copper Hits $6/LB! Scrap Prices Soar Across the Board to Start 2026
summary: Copper traded above $6 per pound for the first time in history, driven by tightening global supply due to tariffs and slowing imports, combined with surging demand from U.S. manufacturing and infrastructure sectors. Analysts forecast continued strength through Q1 2026.

title: Copper price hits record $13000/t as rally continues
summary: The LME cash copper price reached almost $13,300/t on January 6, 2026, setting a new record after pushing above $13,000/t for the first time, driven by tightening global supply and investor optimism.

title: Period of elevated copper prices overextended: analysts
summary: Analysts warn that copper prices exceeding sustainable levels, with the LME benchmark gaining over $2,410/mt since mid-October. StoneX forecasts copper averaging $11,490/mt for 2026, while concerns emerge about demand slowdown in China, the largest copper market.

title: Goldman Sachs raises first-half copper price forecast
summary: Goldman Sachs raised its copper price forecast for the first half of 2026 to $12,750 a metric ton from $11,525 a ton, reflecting bullish sentiment on the metal's near-term prospects.

title: TFM Copper Shipped Directionally to the US, LME Copper Fluctuated Overnight and Closed Higher - SMM Copper Morning Meeting
summary: Gécamines, the DRC state mining company, announced on January 12 it will purchase its full 20% share of 100,000 mt copper production from the TFM copper-cobalt mine in 2026 and ship it directionally to the US market. This implements recent DRC-US agreements. LME copper futures closed higher at $13,172/mt after fluctuations, amid ample domestic supply and rising inventories in China.

title: Codelco expects to lift copper output by 10 000 t this year
summary: Chilean state-run miner Codelco plans to produce 1.344 million metric tons of copper in 2026, an increase of about 10,000 tons from the previous year. This output lift reflects efforts to boost production capacity.

title: MAX RESOURCE ENTERS MASTERS SERVICES AGREEMENT
summary: Max Resource Corp. entered a masters services agreement, highlighting its Serra Azul Copper-Silver Project in Colombia along the Andean copper belt. The project is fully funded by Freeport-McMoRan up to $50 million for an 80% earn-in, validating its geological potential amid global copper supply discussions.

title: Why are commodity prices going crazy?
summary: The nickel price has risen 26% in one month and 13% year over year, signaling a recovery after a three-year slump due to Indonesian oversupply. Improving demand from Chinese stainless steel mills and EV battery producers supports the rebound, amid supply uncertainty from Indonesia's potential 34% output cut in 2026.

title: [1.14 Nickel Morning Meeting Summary] SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate price stays flat WoW
summary: On January 13, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index price held steady at 26423 yuan/mt. The quotation range remained flat week-over-week amid ongoing market monitoring.

title: Nickel price spikes more than 10% as Chinese buying fuels metals surge
summary: Nickel prices spiked over 10% to $18,785 a ton on the LME, the biggest gain in over three years, driven by Chinese investor buying and risks to Indonesian supply. This extends a 30% rise since mid-December, reversing oversupply issues despite weaker EV battery demand.

title: Nickel falls from 19-month peak as metals rally pauses
summary: Nickel prices slipped 0.8% to $18,370 a ton after surging up to 10.5% intraday to near $18,800, pausing the base metals rally. Factors include Indonesia's production cut plans and strong Chinese buying for nickel pig iron ahead of Lunar New Year.

title: Metals - Nickel: supportive macro-backdrop to further boost LME price
summary: LME nickel trades at ~US$18k/t, a 19-month high, driven by Indonesia's plan to cut FY26F RKAB quota. Supportive macro factors are expected to further elevate prices.

title: Canada Nickel Announces 46% Increase in Measured & Indicated Resource at Reid Nickel Sulphide Project
summary: Canada Nickel reported a 46% increase in Measured & Indicated resources at its Reid nickel sulphide project, reaching 2.1 million tonnes of contained nickel from 0.87 billion tonnes at 0.23% Ni. The Timmins Nickel District now totals eight deposits with 10.1 million tonnes Measured & Indicated contained nickel. Inferred resources also grew to 3.22 million tonnes contained nickel.

title: Nickel Prices Jump After Top Producer Indonesia Signals 2026 Output Cut
summary: Indonesia plans to cut nickel production in 2026 to balance supply and demand amid rising LME inventories, leading to a price jump to $16,500 per tonne. The country, holding 60.2% of global market share in 2024, aims to curb surplus and support prices while limiting environmental impact. Production quotas for miners will be adjusted accordingly.

title: Nickel is the leading base metal on the market due to uncertainty about Indonesian output
summary: Uncertainty surrounds Indonesia's 2026 mining output quota after the government refused to disclose details, raising concerns over supply restrictions. Nickel prices dropped sharply, with LME three-month contract falling 4.05% to $17,170 per ton amid plans to reduce quotas based on local smelter demand. This follows an upward trend fueled by anticipated production cuts.

title: Nickel price extends drop amid lack of detail on Indonesia output cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell further from a 19-month high as Indonesia provided no details on its pledged 2026 output cuts during a ministry briefing. Three-month LME futures declined up to 5.9%, settling 4.1% lower at $17,155 per ton, despite earlier surges to $18,800. The moves reflect ongoing supply-demand balancing efforts in the top producer.

title: Indonesia quota talk triggers nickel reality check
summary: Nickel prices surged on speculation of Indonesia slashing 2026 ore quotas by a third to 250 million tonnes, potentially removing 700,000 tonnes of supply and flipping the market to deficit. However, a massive 20,760-tonne LME warranting on Jan. 7 highlighted ongoing oversupply, pulling prices back from $18,800. Processing capacity constraints outside China limit quick responses from new mines.

title: Weiming to trial second nickel matte line at Indonesia's Jiaman project
summary: Weiming plans to trial a second nickel matte production line at its Jiaman project in Indonesia. This expansion aims to boost nickel processing capacity at the site.

title: Strengthening nickel resources, MBMA spends IDR 44.37 billion
summary: MBMA invested IDR 44.37 billion to complete 1,659 drill holes at the SCM Mine, upgrading the status of its nickel resources. This effort strengthens the company's nickel asset base.

title: Clean energy supply chains of the future need a circular economy
summary: A circular economy can provide a secondary supply source for critical minerals like nickel used in clean energy technologies such as batteries and electric vehicles, reducing emissions by up to 80% compared to mining. This approach strengthens supply chain resilience amid concentrated primary supplies and supports post-COP30 goals for accelerating the energy transition. Discussions at the World Economic Forum's Annual Meeting 2026 will explore balancing environmental protection with economic growth.

title: Can nickel prices hit $25,000 in 2026?
summary: Nickel prices have rallied to $16,500–$18,500 per ton in early January 2026, driven by shifts toward high-grade, low-carbon nickel sulphide projects like Canada Nickel's Crawford project amid declining Indonesian supply quality. These projects are vital for secure, non-Chinese controlled nickel supply chains essential for EVs and green technologies. Indonesia's focus on maximizing returns from existing investments highlights the strategic importance of Tier-1 jurisdiction assets.

title: How 2026 will reshape US critical minerals resilience
summary: In 2026, US critical minerals investment will expand beyond rare earths to processing innovations for metals like nickel, focusing on low-emission technologies to reduce reliance on outdated methods and overseas supply. Advances in sustainable processing will attract federal funding, positioning the US as a leader in efficient mining amid competition for power from AI and data centers. This shift emphasizes cost-effective production to strengthen domestic manufacturing and supply chain security.

title: Melissa “Mel” Sanderson to Champion Critical Minerals Sustainability at Future Minerals Forum 2026
summary: Melissa Sanderson will speak at Future Minerals Forum 2026 on January 15 about funding rare earth and critical mineral exploration, addressing US supply gaps, national security, and sustainable development. The forum, themed 'Dawn of a Global Cause,' unites leaders to advance ESG-integrated policies for resilient mineral supply chains powering energy transition and tech innovation. Her expertise emphasizes responsible sourcing and aligning private sector with policymakers.

title: Tenaris (TS) repurchases 3.32M shares in week under USD1.2B buyback program
summary: Tenaris S.A. repurchased 3,320,025 ordinary shares for €54.6 million (USD64.2 million) between December 29, 2025, and January 2, 2026, as part of its USD1.2 billion share buyback program. Following these transactions, the company holds 62,328,172 ordinary shares in treasury, representing 5.81% of its total issued share capital. Tenaris intends to cancel these treasury shares in due course.
